subject: Education
title: Serial Position Effect: First and Last Stick
description: A micro-lesson that makes Serial Position Effect: First and Last Stick usable.

hook.text: Read a list of 20 words and you'll remember the first few and last few best. The middle? Gone.

buildup.text: The serial position effect splits into primacy (first items) and recency (last items).

discovery.text: First items get rehearsed more; last items are still sitting in short-term memory.

twist.text: Advertisers exploit this: the first and last ads in a break are the most expensive slots.

climax.text: Placing key information at the start and end of lessons dramatically increases retention.

punchline.text: Start strong and finish strongâ€”the middle fades.

quiz.question: What does the serial position effect predict about list recall?
options: People best remember items at the beginning and end of a list
The middle items are always remembered most vividly
All items in a list are forgotten at the same rate
